greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) is the length of terminal cycle of the trajectory of f(x)=phi(sigma(x)) if started at 2^n.
formula: a(n) = A095955(2^n). - _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Nov 27 2013
mathematica: g[n_] := EulerPhi[ DivisorSigma[1, n]]; f[n_] := Block[{lst = NestWhileList[g, n, UnsameQ, All]}, -Subtract @@ Flatten[ Position[lst, lst[[ -1]]]]]; Table[ f[2^n], {n, 0, 20}]
program: a(n)=my(t=f(2^n), h=f(t), s); while(t!=h, t=f(t); h=f(f(h))); t=f(t); h=f(t); s=1; while(t!=h, s++; t=f(t); h=f(f(h))); s \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Nov 27 2013
results.author: _Labos Elemer_, Jul 16 2004
ext: Edited, corrected and extended by _Robert G. Wilson v_, Jul 17 2004
